reviews.review:
Friends who are familiar with the comic book version of the Russo brothers Avenger's: Infinity War tell me that the movie stays mostly true to the original stories. The problem is, of course, that a movie is different than a comic book. With a running time of over 2 hours and 40 minutes, I found myself alternating between boredom, impatience and frustration. Sure, there were bright spots, like every time Bruce Banner fought with his inner demon (Hulk). And all my favorite characters made an appearance. But, overall, I kept waiting to be entertained and constantly disappointed. I wanted something good or interesting to happen. Instead, key characters kept dropping at the hands of Thanos, who could have easily been stopped if someone had simply cut off his arm.
Movies plots based on such flimsy logic are never my favorites. There simply wasn't enough good stuff to offset all the idiotic plot holes that would allow me to forgive Infinity War for all its flaws. There were a few bright spots, like when Groot helps Thor reforge his hammer. And anytime the Guardians of the Galaxy were on screen I was a happy camper.
In my mind, though, I kept imagining what I would have done differently to make Infinity Wars a better, more enjoyable experience. For one thing, I would have split it into three 2-hour movies and ended on a lighter, more fun note. The ending sucked, and I knew it wasn't for real. I felt manipulated. I felt like the movie makers were being nasty and taking the audience for granted. I may not be able to forgive them. They stole three hours from me that I will never get back watching this junked up mess of a film. I ended up liking most of the characters less as a result. And since a whole bunch of them are "gone" now, supposedly, I'm not sure whether I care if they ever come back.

"Avengers: Infinity War" is both awesome and flawed. Wonder still arise in its imperfection. "Infinity War" is The Avengers' catharsis. The visuals dazzle. The battles have never been more spectacular or costly. Despite having way too many superheroes in this 2 hour and 40 minute epic, what compels is villain Thanos, played by powerful sad Josh Brolin.
Galactic warrior Thanos is the hulking man-like creature, Son of Saturn's Moon Titan. I got what Thanos is about. As a child he witnessed his vibrant Titan die, because of over population. Thus, exhausting its resources. That was his epiphany, his cause. 
He "adopts" daughers Gamora, played by Zoe Saldana, and Nebula, played by Karen Gillan, on his merciless conquests across the universe. 
Thanos possess the Infinity Gauntlet, the golden mechanical glove with powerful Infinity Stones. When he finds all 6 Infinity Stones, he can wipe out half of humanity in the universe with a snap of his finger. In his own delusional way, be truly believe this is for the greater good. 
Although "Infinity War" is not greater than "Black Panther", it is great. "Infinity War" is Act 2 of The Avengers heroic morality play.

Chris Hemsworth, Benedict Cumberbatch, Zoe Saldana, and Chris Evans rock as Thor, Doctor Strange, Gamora, and Captain America. Hemsworth is super badass as Thor, who is fueled by vengeance upon Thanos. Cumberbatch is strong and wise as Doctor Strange, who may hold the key to this "endgame". Evans is all conviction and earnest idealism as Steve Roger's Captain. Saldana is very powerful in the humanity of her love and hate for her father Thanos.

That Father-Daughter dynamic resonates above the distracting number of Superheroes and the splintered narratives. So was it worth it for Thanos in the end? Did he get what he truly desired? "Infinity War" does surprise in great ways. So it was worth it at least for me. Even with the totally WTF conclusion, I still hold hope. We'll all have to wait for may 2019 to see...
Now i can proudly say that the  10 years wait was worth it .
Amazing culmination of ten years worth of movies
In my opinion, the worst Marvel movie to date. I was bored, angry and sad all at the same time.
MASTERPIECE BEST MOVIE EVER IT WILL LITERALLY KEEP YOU AT THE EDGE OF YOUR SITS STUNNINGLY TRILLING
Its not perfect, its not even complete, but at least is not what  you have expected
my bae loved it, love you Maya
Fun all the way through. I brought the whole family and we enjoyed it. My daughter even cried at one point. We loved it. Marvel has that magic. 5 out of 5.
